title: Carrier Aggregation Mode Issues
content:
I have a US Pixel 2 and a US Pixel 3 in Thailand.  The Pixel 2 works fine except for seemingly slow mobile data.  I moved the sim from the 2 to the 3.  Then both wifi and mobile data would constantly reset.  Replaced sim, 5 factory resets, troubleshot at the carrier and with Google support which authorized a replacement.  After thinking about the issue, I turned off LTE on the 3 and everything starting working.  Before this, the 2 never showed LTE but the 3 would on occasion.
I know the 3 has added some bands that the 2 didn't have which probably allowed the 3 to attempt LTE.  I have seen a setting on the 3 something like Enable Carrier Aggregation Mode but I can no longer find it.  I know that US carrier aggregation is not compatible with Thai bands.  I have a feeling that the CA setting only appears if LTE is connected.  Since turning LTE on is so unstable that I can not get it to show LTE for more than a few seconds.
Therefore, how can I turn off the Carrier Aggregation mode if I cannot keep LTE on long enough?
I could be wrong, but I believe that would solve the issue and still give me better performance than my current 3G setting.
